 Are you interested in space and eager to expand your knowledge in an international environment? Join the Spring School at the University of Namur, where you will experience lectures, workshops, and astronaut training at the Euro Space Center! Recruitment is open until February 9, 2025. 

 Description 

We invite AGH students to participate in the Spring School organized by the University of Namur in Belgium as part of the UNIVERSEH 2.0 project. The event will take place on April 21-27, 2025, at the University of Namur and the 
Euro Space Center
. Additionally, participants will take part in a mandatory online component starting in early March.

No prior knowledge is required!

Stay at the Euro Space Center

A key part of the Spring School will be the stay at the Euro Space Center.

We invite AGH students to participate in the Spring School organized by the University of Namur in Belgium as part of the UNIVERSEH 2.0 project. The event will take place on April 21-27, 2025, at the University of Namur and the Euro Space Center. Additionally, participants will take part in a mandatory online component starting in early March.

No prior knowledge is required!

Stay at the Euro Space Center

A key part of the Spring School will be the stay at the Euro Space Center. Located 65 km from Namur, the Euro Space Center is an educational theme park dedicated to space, training future astronauts since 1991. Nearby, you will find ESA/ESEC, ESA’s satellite control center and the first space systems cybersecurity training center in Europe. The ESA Education Training Center is responsible for all ESA training programs for university students.

Important Information

 10 (for AGH students – undergraduate, master's, and PhD students)

Participation cost:

€80 per day

Erasmus+ program
 (up to 
€79 per day

Spring School Program

 on space-related topics (e.g., space law, cybersecurity, satellite operations, astronautics).

 and the ESA ESEC-Redu station.

Speed meeting
 with space industry professionals.

Cosmicathon
 – a team-based project challenge focused on space missions.

Planetarium sessions
 and 
stargazing observations
